dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so like, I'm looking at this forecast here, and it says March 14th, right? Night temperatures from minus eight to minus ten Celsius. Minus ten?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so like, I'm looking at this forecast here, and it says March fourteenth, right? Night temperatures from minus eight to minus ten Celsius. Minus ten?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: March 14: ... Temperature: from -8 to -10ÂC at night, around 0ÂC during the day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, uh, for, for Astana, that's what Kazhydromet is saying. It's, you know, still quite cold there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, uh, for, for Astana, that's what Kazhydromet is saying. It's, you know, still quite cold there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazhydromet has announced the weather forecast for Almaty and Astana for the next three days, from March 14 to March 16.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But then, uh, B, you scroll down a little, and it says March 14th again. And suddenly it's zero to minus two at night, and then plus eleven to plus thirteen during the day? What is even happening?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then, uh, B, you scroll down a little, and it says March fourteenth again. And suddenly it's zero to minus two at night, and then plus eleven to plus thirteen during the day? What is even happening?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: March 14: Variable cloudiness, no precipitation. Southwest wind 2-7 m/s. Temperature: from 0 to -2ÂC at night, from +11 to +13ÂC during the day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so that second part, um, that's for Almaty. The article just, like, lists them separately.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so that second part, um, that's for Almaty. The article just, like, lists them separately.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazhydromet has announced the weather forecast for Almaty and Astana for the next three days, from March 14 to March 16.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So they just… put two March 14ths in the same paragraph without, you know, telling us which city is which until you, like, guess? That's, that's just bad reporting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they just... put two March 14ths in the same paragraph without, you know, telling us which city is which until you, like, guess? That's, that's just bad reporting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's just the way it's presented. The, uh, the temperatures make it clear, usually. One's colder.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's just the way it's presented. The, uh, the temperatures make it clear, usually. One's colder.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Clear? One's going from minus ten to plus thirteen on the same day depending on which line you read. And then there's ice on roads and rain later. Like, which one is it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Clear? One's going from minus ten to plus thirteen on the same day depending on which line you read. And then there's ice on roads and rain later. Like, which one is it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: March 14: ... Temperature: from -8 to -10ÂC at night... March 14: ... Temperature: ... from +11 to +13ÂC during the day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's, it's both. Depending on the city. And the forecast does say, um, "precipitation during the day " for that first March 14th.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's, it's both. Depending on the city. And the forecast does say, um, precipitation during the day for that first March fourteenth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: March 14: Variable cloudiness, precipitation during the day (rain, snow).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Rain, snow, ice, plus thirteen degrees. Great. Sounds like a, uh, a real stable weather system they've got going on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Rain, snow, ice, plus thirteen degrees. Great. Sounds like a, uh, a real stable weather system they've got going on.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And then, uh, wind gusts up to fifteen, twenty meters per second on the sixteenth. That's pretty significant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then, uh, wind gusts up to fifteen, twenty meters per second on the sixteenth. That's pretty significant.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Twenty meters per second. So, like, gale force winds then? Is anyone, you know, supposed to be out in that? Because it also mentions highways being closed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Twenty meters per second. So, like, gale force winds then? Is anyone, you know, supposed to be out in that? Because it also mentions highways being closed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition, several more highways were closed due to bad weather in the Kostanay and North Kazakhstan regions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it says, um, "several more highways were closed due to bad weather in the Kostanay and North Kazakhstan regions."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it says, um, several more highways were closed due to bad weather in the Kostanay and North Kazakhstan regions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition, several more highways were closed due to bad weather in the Kostanay and North Kazakhstan regions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But they're forecasting plus thirteen with rain in one place, and, like, deep freeze in another, on the same day? How much confidence can we really have in this "Kazhydromet"?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But they're forecasting plus thirteen with rain in one place, and, like, deep freeze in another, on the same day? How much confidence can we really have in this Kazhydromet?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: March 14: ... Temperature: from -8 to -10ÂC at night... March 15: ... rain during the day. ... Temperature: ... from +13 to +15ÂC during the day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They're the national weather service. They're, uh, they're generally reliable for the region.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're the national weather service. They're, uh, they're generally reliable for the region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. Just, uh, you know, maybe don't plan your weekend around this very precise, yet also extremely contradictory, forecast.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. Just, uh, you know, maybe don't plan your weekend around this very precise, yet also extremely contradictory, forecast.
